article.headline: Montana 82, Loyola Marymount 73
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Anthony Johnson scored 22 points and Derek Selvig had a double-double to lead Montana to an 82-73 victory over Loyola Marymount on Thursday night. Johnson made only four baskets but sank all 14 free throws, including six over the final 25 seconds to ice the game. He also had five assists and five rebounds. Selvig had 18 points and 10 rebounds, scoring 15 in the first half. Ryan Staudacher scored 18 points and Will Cherry 10 for the Grizzlies (6-3). Drew Viney led Marymount (3-7) with his first double-double, getting 22 points and 10 rebounds. Kevin Young added 18 points. The victory was the Grizzlies' second over the Lions in less than a month. Montana pulled out a 64-63 thriller at home Nov. 15. Trailing 42-38 at halftime, Montana used a 13-0 run to take charge. The Lions never led after that.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
